title: you can see Aurilion Sol before you actually see him..
body:
His passive is literally visible while he's in brush and coming around corners giving a big heads up to opponents..

{{champion:84}} I wonder where Sol could be..

{{champion:86}} I'm almost positive the brush didn't have orbiting stars 10 mins ago..

replies.body: I like my enemies knowing that their doom is coming.

A summoner has disconnected

PENTAKILL!

XD
It's both kind of an ability and passive so it's kind of on the fence for me in terms of is it fair
they did mention that it was intentional during the Rabid Llama live stream.

Yeh...giant space dragon not so sneaky.
Just one of his drawbacks.
Think of it this way-
He can surprise gank *any* lane from *any* angle at massive speeds from a huge distance away, ignoring all terrain, and without indicators like Sion/Rek'Sai ulti global sound or glowing bright Bard portal that enemies can follow you through. But in exchange, he can't use brush very effectively.
Good tradeoff I think.
actually, in the preview of aurelion, his E marked the position he was going with a blue icon

Yeh, I think that may be team only though? Unsure.
In the gameplay video I watched it was sol mid vs sol jungle. Only remember seeing topside's marker. Never saw the 'enemy' one, maybe I just missed it though.

His passive is basically an ability, if you couldn't see it it would be kind of like back in the dark days of invisible Nid spears and Mundo cleavers and he would just sit in a bush hitting you with an ability you cant see.
since he can stun the whole lane from downtown i feel like its fair hes not as sneaky as others tho
